OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacquelyn C. Soldner was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System consecutive.  Defendant is entitled to 5 days presentence credit.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within the term of Extended Supervision. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of release.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
Case called along with 15CF38.  Gilbert G. Thompson appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with her attorney William Mayer.  The State filed Amended Informations for each case.   Ct. reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard plea in Case No. 15CF21 Guilty to OWI-6th with the Minor Passenger Enhancer being dismissed. and also heard her plea in Case No. 15CF38 of Guilty to OWI-7th with the Minor Passenger Enhancer being dismissed.  Court found probable cause for each case.  Ct. found her pleas were given FKVI, accepted both pleas, and found Def. guilty of the charge(s) stated above. Based upon her pleas to these two charges, Count 2 in 15CF21 is dismissed and Count 2 in 15CF38 is also dismissed.  In 15CF38, the Court ordered Counts 3, 4, and 5 are DRI.  Ct. found factual basis for each case and they are to be considered 6th and 7th offenses.  BAC in 15CF21 was .379% and in 15CF38, her BAC was .101%.   Ct. heard from State and Defense and sentenced as follows:
As to 15CF21: 
54 mos in the WI DOC:  18 months IC, 36 months ES, consecutive to any prior sentence, with VIP as part of extended supervision; absolute sobriety, no bars, liquor stores, and must have a valid presc. for any drug use 
Fine of $2,400
Court costs 
$26 for the blood draw fee
AODA/followthrough 
36 mos. revocation of DL
36 mos. of IIL 
Driver Improvement Surcharge 
5 days presentence credit 

As to 15CF38:
72 months in the WI DOC: 36 months IC, 36 months ES consecutive to any prior sentence, with a VIP as part of extended supervision; absolute sobriety, no bars, liquor stores, and must have a valid precr. for any drug use
NO FINE
Court costs 
$26 for the blood draw
36 mos. revocation of DL
36 mos. of IIL 
AODA/followthrough 
Driver Improvement Surcharge 
41 days presentence credit

Defendant is eligible for the Earned Release Program 
Cash bail to be applied towards fines, blood draws and costs
BAC
Status conference on May 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Court heard; finds eligible for court appointed counsel and appoints Atty Bill Mayer at rate of $50/bi-weekly commencing 2/20/15 and bi-weekly as paid. Discussion held on PH. Def waives time limits. Court reschedules PH.

12:57 - Defendant Jacquelyn C. Soldner in court, in custody w/Intern Austin Heimann w/Atty Vollan (not eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $10,000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
